metadata.TITLE: Catch Up On The Latest News Clips - ITVX
metadata.DESC: Discover the latest and breaking news clips from ITV. ITVX - The UK's freshest streaming service.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: The latest ITV News headlines - as former Prime Minister Boris Johnson resigns as MP
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch a short summary of today's top stories from the ITV News team.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Boris Johnson stands down as MP after receiving Partygate report
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Boris Johnson is resigning as an MP after accusing a Commons investigation into whether he misled Parliament over partygate of attempting to "drive me out".

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: What does Boris Johnson's resignation mean for the future of the Tory party?
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: ITV News' Paul Brand and Anushka Asthana discuss Johnson's scathing resignation statement and what might happen next, for both Boris and the Conservative party.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Donald Trump faces 37 felony counts according to unsealed indictment
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The former U.S. President posted on social media suggesting the charges were linked to the handling of classified documents and said he was "an innocent man".

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Hotter in the UK than in Tenerife? Heat health warning comes into force
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Parts of England are predicted to reach temperatures of around 30 degrees, with amber heat alerts in force for some until Monday morning.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Ask ITV: Your questions answered on the Amber heat alert
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: ITV viewers across the country have been asking what the amber heat alerts mean. Our science correspondent Martin Stew has the answers for you.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Putin says Russian tactical nuclear weapons to be deployed on European soil
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Russia will start deploying tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus after special storage facilities are made ready, President Vladimir Putin announced.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Youth unemployment in China almost doubles since 2019
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: In the first quarter of 2019 it was 11.3%, now it has risen to 20.4%. More and more students are graduating, but since the pandemic there are not enough jobs.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Students injured and one arrested in 'serious assault' at private school in Devon
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Three people are in hospital after being injured in a 'serious assault' at Blundell's School in Tiverton on Friday morning. A teenager has been arrested.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Alps stabbing attack: Emmanuel Macron visits victims and families in hospital
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron travelled to the hospital treating three of the four children who suffered life-threatening injuries. A British child is in a stable condition.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Beverley Knight's tribute to parents in Windrush 75 concert
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: On stage at the Royal Albert Hall, marking the 75th anniversary of Windrush, Knight said she was thinking of her parents and their 'resilience'.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Hot and humid: The latest ITV Weather forecast
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch the latest UK forecast from the ITV Weather team.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Watch Thursday's ITV News at Ten

longformData.title: ITV News at Ten
longformData.description: The latest news from ITV News at Ten.

longformData.title: ITV Evening News
longformData.description: All the latest news from the ITV Evening News team

longformData.title: Good Morning Britain
longformData.description: BAFTA-nominated breakfast show covering the latest news, sport & weather

longformData.title: King Charles III: The Coronation
longformData.description: History in the making - relive the day in full

longformData.title: Tonight
longformData.description: Compelling current affairs stories that get to the heart of what matters

longformData.title: Peston
longformData.description: ITV News' Robert Peston presents his lively political interview programme

longformData.title: 60 Minutes: Prince Harry Interview
longformData.description: Prince Harry sits down with Anderson Cooper from CBS' 60 Minutes

longformData.title: Highlights
longformData.description: A moment in history - watch highlights from an unforgettable day

clips.episodeTitle: Boris Johnson receives findings of Parliament's Partygate investigation
clips.synopsis: The former Prime Minister was questioned in March by the Privileges Committee, on whether he misled MPs over Partygate. Johnson now has a draft of its report.

clips.episodeTitle: Rishi Sunak and Joe Biden announce new partnership to boost economic security
clips.synopsis: The Atlantic Declaration, announced at the White House, falls short of a full free trade deal. UK officials says it's a better response to current challenges.

clips.episodeTitle: Green Party's only MP Caroline Lucas to stand down at the next election
clips.synopsis: Caroline Lucas has said her role in Parliament has meant she has "struggled to spend the time I want" on climate concerns and the environment.

clips.episodeTitle: Chair of Covid-19 Inquiry says it should be her decision which material is relevant
clips.synopsis: Baroness Hallett reacted to the Cabinet Office's decision to block full access to Boris Johnson's WhatsApp messages from when he was Prime Minister.

clips.episodeTitle: Rishi Sunak insists plan to reduce small boats crossing the Channel is working
clips.synopsis: The Prime Minister shared the progress made in the six months since he introduced the Illegal Migration Bill.

clips.episodeTitle: Senior minister says migration targets are 'not helpful' after Tories miss theirs
clips.synopsis: Immigration Minister Robert Jenrick said migration targets are not "particularly helpful" - despite previous Tory promises to keep figures below 100,000 a year.

clips.episodeTitle: Boris Johnson warned he could lose legal funding for Covid inquiry
clips.synopsis: Johnson has been warned he could lose public funding for legal advice if he continues to "frustrate or undermine" the Government's position on the Covid inquiry

clips.episodeTitle: The government may be about to announce funding to fill thousands of NHS vacancies
clips.synopsis: The government is reportedly set to announce that £1bn will be spent on filling vacancies in the NHS in England. The funding would train thousands of new staff.

clips.episodeTitle: Boris Johnson says he can't access many of his pandemic Whatsapp messages
clips.synopsis: The former PM says the security services told him not to access his old phone, after a privacy breach. The phone holds messages requested by the Covid Inquiry.

clips.episodeTitle: Plans to relax rules on academic qualifications of childcare providers
clips.synopsis: The government wants more people to consider jobs in childcare as it expands its free hours provision, but critics are worried it could drive down standards.

clips.episodeTitle: Government to crackdown on underage vaping after rise in e-cigarettes use
clips.synopsis: Ministers plan to close a loophole allowing retailers to give free samples to children. NHS figures show 9% of those aged 11 to 15 used e-cigarettes in 2021.

clips.episodeTitle: Ministers asking supermarkets to consider cutting prices on basic food items
clips.synopsis: It's understood the agreement with major retailers would be voluntary and could see price reductions on items to help tackle the cost of living crisis.

clips.episodeTitle: Donald Trump faces 37 felony counts according to unsealed indictment
clips.synopsis: The former U.S. President posted on social media suggesting the charges were linked to the handling of classified documents and said he was "an innocent man".

clips.episodeTitle: Alps stabbing attack: Emmanuel Macron visits victims and families in hospital
clips.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron travelled to the hospital treating three of the four children who suffered life-threatening injuries. A British child is in a stable condition.

clips.episodeTitle: Ukrainian residents trapped by floods as fears grow over dislodged landmines
clips.synopsis: The Red Cross says floodwater from a destroyed dam in Ukraine has uprooted landmines, which will pose a danger to civilians for decades to come.

clips.episodeTitle: Rishi Sunak and Joe Biden announce new partnership to boost economic security
clips.synopsis: The Atlantic Declaration, announced at the White House, falls short of a full free trade deal. UK officials says it's a better response to current challenges.

clips.episodeTitle: Raging wildfires in Canada spreading smoke south into U.S. and as far as Norway
clips.synopsis: As hundreds of wildfires continue to burn in Canada, the hazardous haze from them is disrupting daily life for millions - with many being told to stay inside.

clips.episodeTitle: What could the consequences be of the Ukraine dam attack?
clips.synopsis: The collapse of the Kakhovka dam is likely to have far-reaching and long-lasting effects on the southern region of Ukraine and beyond.

clips.episodeTitle: Calls for Duke's U.S. visa records to be released over past drug-use revelations
clips.synopsis: A Conservative think tank is demanding that Prince Harry's records be unsealed to check whether he previously admitted using drugs on his U.S. visa form.

clips.episodeTitle: Veterans remember D-Day landings on 79th anniversary of Normandy invasion
clips.synopsis: Services are being held today to mark 79 years since the invasion which turned the tide against Nazi Germany in World War II.

clips.episodeTitle: Miraculous rescue as sherpa carries stricken climber to safety on Mount Everest
clips.synopsis: A Nepalese sherpa has saved the life of a climber who was freezing to death near the summit of the mountain, by carrying him on his back for hours.

clips.episodeTitle: Madeleine McCann: Number of items seized in fresh search ‘cannot yet be linked’ to disappearance
clips.synopsis: Police investigating the disappearance of Madeleine McCann have confirmed "a number of items were seized" after the recent search at a Portuguese dam.

clips.episodeTitle: U.S. military criticises Chinese jet pilot's "unnecessarily aggressive" manoeuvre
clips.synopsis: U.S. authorities say the Chinese fighter pilot flew directly in front of the nose of the American aircraft forcing it to fly through its wake turbulence.

clips.episodeTitle: Chilling warning from mother whose son was killed in dog attack
clips.synopsis: Ten-year-old Jack Lis was attacked by an XL Bully in 2021. Now his mother Emma Whitfield is campaigning for a change in the law around dangerous dogs.

clips.episodeTitle: The pioneering surgical robots which could be key to cutting NHS waiting times
clips.synopsis: ITV News visits Guy's and St Thomas' hospital trust, which has seven robots in their operating theatres, carrying out up to 1,500 procedures a year.

clips.episodeTitle: The U.S. city with a murder rate 20 times the national average
clips.synopsis: New figures show there have been 70 murders so far in St.Louis this year - predominantly from gun crime. Dan Rivers visits the streets of this dangerous city.

clips.episodeTitle: The fears and frustration facing many of the UK's elderly carers
clips.synopsis: ITV News speaks to 79-year-old Jessie, a full-time carer of her disabled son Andrew. She says she's frightened about what will happen to him when she dies.

clips.episodeTitle: 'An attempt to smear the LGBT community': The battle over Tennessee's 'drag ban'
clips.synopsis: Campaigners are trying to block a new law in Tennessee, which bans drag performances anywhere a child might see them. Dan Rivers reports for 'On Assignment'.

clips.episodeTitle: John Cleese says phone hacking experience left him feeling 'slightly violated'
clips.synopsis: The Fawlty Towers star spoke to ITV News as he attended London's High Court, for the high profile hacking case against Mirror Group Newspapers.

clips.episodeTitle: Worrying levels of E. coli found inside some UK oysters
clips.synopsis: Exclusive research carried out by ITV News and Watershed Investigations found some shellfish areas have seven times the E. coli levels deemed safe for eating.

clips.episodeTitle: The chaos and confusion caused by the ever-expanding power of A.I
clips.synopsis: An ITV News documentary has been exploring the risks posed by artificial intelligence, such as its power to undermine democracy or impersonate individuals.

clips.episodeTitle: Fresh claims of misogyny and bullying behaviour within Metropolitan Police
clips.synopsis: A former detective within the Met has given an inside account of her time in the force. Jess McDonald’s book 'No Comment' is out on Thursday, May 25.

clips.episodeTitle: Bludgeoned from behind: Survivor of alleged Levi Bellfield attack speaks out
clips.synopsis: A woman who believes she was attacked by Millie Dowler's killer Levi Bellfield has told ITV News how police failed to tell her of his alleged confession.

clips.episodeTitle: Exclusive figures reveal a third of children being exposed to vape adverts online
clips.synopsis: The Advertising Standards Authority say they are increasingly concerned about e-cigarette promotions targeting young people online.

clips.episodeTitle: How a group of volunteer British doctors are helping to save lives in Syria
clips.synopsis: The doctors from the UK are training and supporting local medics still dealing with the aftermath of February's devastating earthquakes.

clips.episodeTitle: The people pushed to their limits by the cost of living crisis
clips.synopsis: Watch 'Life & Debt: Stories from the Edge', an ITV News documentary looking at the true impact the squeeze in living standards is having on people in the UK.

clips.episodeTitle: Hayfever feeling worse than ever? Why some people are blaming male trees
clips.synopsis: You may have heard that symptoms in urban areas have been amplified by the planting of 'male trees' - but could there be any truth to these claims?

clips.episodeTitle: What were the key moments from Prince Harry's time on the stand?
clips.synopsis: After two days of giving evidence at the High Court in his case against Mirror Group Newspapers, ITV News examines what we have learnt from Harry's testimony.

clips.episodeTitle: What could the consequences be of the Ukraine dam attack?
clips.synopsis: The collapse of the Kakhovka dam is likely to have far-reaching and long-lasting effects on the southern region of Ukraine and beyond.

clips.episodeTitle: Duke of Sussex V Mirror Group Newspapers: What is the trial about?
clips.synopsis: Prince Harry will be cross-examined in the High Court this week as he gives evidence in his legal action against Mirror Group Newspapers.

clips.episodeTitle: Covid-19 Inquiry: Why is the government taking legal action?
clips.synopsis: A preliminary hearing of the Covid Inquiry is underway, with the chair addressing the government's planned legal action over the release of material.

clips.episodeTitle: Heat health Alert Service: What is it and how will it work?
clips.synopsis: As the first heat health alert of the year comes into force today, we explain what the new weather alert system aims to do.

clips.episodeTitle: How seriously should we take warnings that AI could lead to our extinction?
clips.synopsis: Experts have warned that mitigating the risk of 'extinction' should be a global priority on the same level as pandemics and wars.

clips.episodeTitle: Women's World Cup: What you need to know ahead of the tournament
clips.synopsis: As Sarina Wiegman announces her squad for the summer World Cup, what else do we know about the competition?

clips.episodeTitle: Another rail operator to ban electric scooters - where and why?
clips.synopsis: South Western Railway is joining rail operator Great Western Railway, Transport for London and Nexus in banning e-scooters across the country.

clips.episodeTitle: What are the key events in the disappearance of Madeleine McCann?
clips.synopsis: In the week police divers searched a dam in Portugal, we look back at the 16 year long investigation into the disappearance of three-year-old Madeleine McCann.

clips.episodeTitle: The top four scams to be on the lookout for
clips.synopsis: Online scams are on the rise - from suspicious links in emails, to adverts for investment opportunities on social media. Here's what to look out for.

clips.episodeTitle: What has the human and financial cost of climate change been?
clips.synopsis: New statistics show the extent of damage climate change is already causing. From floods in Italy to wildfires in Canada, we explain the results.
